text:
^^ working for me with “img”, not “img_src”:
```[{ 
              "caption":  "A",
              "show_caption": false,
              "link_url": "",
              "alt_text": "",
              "img": { 
                "src": "<https://static.HubSpot.com/final/img/content/email-template-images/placeholder_200x200.png>", 
                "alt": "placeholder_200x200", 
                "width": 200, 
                "height": 200 
              },
              "open_in_new_tab": false
            }]```
Unless you can fit your data into the standard crm objects
the only ones you can use on public pages are product/marketing_event
I'm trying to make an asset register in HubDB then link each row to a company

I think thats where CRM custom objects comes in, and unfortunately non enterprise plans don’t have access to this.  If you’re not using the products crm object you may be able to retrofit this, but I imagine that’s less than ideal.
Additionally - as hubdb has no relationship fields which link to companies - that may become a bit messy.
If you must - there are some API methods for workflows and hubdb - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/create-manage-workflows>
We are using products for quotes
which then links into Xero invoicing via an integration
